section.name: Jadabs - AOP
section.p: A core feature of Jadabs is its integrated AOP capabilities. We look at AOP in two different ways. First, as a static way of extending software components with new functionality. Second, as a behavior change at runtime which would otherwise lead to a restart of a running component.
On the download page different AOP configurations are supported. Following we discuss how we support the two AOP types static and dynamic.

subsection.name: static AOP
subsection.p: The Jadabs core has been built by using AspectJ itself. The core platform consists therefore of the AspectJ runtime library per default.

subsection.name: dynamic AOP
subsection.p: As a basic dynamic AOP concept Nanning is supported. As Nanning runs on J2ME-CDC VMs it is included per default.
For nodes with VMs running on the normal VM the dynamic AOP approach from Prose can be included.
